intro: Isochilus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf isochilus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
